H0.text: Which hormone helps control ovulation. Estrogen

H1.text: Which hormone helps control ovulation. Progesterone

H2.text: Which hormone helps control ovulation. Follicle-Stimulating Hormone (FSH)

H3.text: Which hormone helps control ovulation. Lh kit

A4.text: FSH initiates follicular growth, specifically affecting granulosa cells. This seems to be critical in selecting only the most advanced follicle to proceed to ovulation.

A5.text: The sharp increase in estradiol production by the dominant follicle... cause a positive effect on the hypothalamus and pituitary and rapid GnRH pulses occur and an LH surge results.

A6.text: FSH stimulates cumulus expansion in the preovulatory phase.

A7.text: Ovulation is stimulated by an increase in luteinizing hormone (LH).

A9.text: LH induces granulosa cell luteinization, progesterone synthesis, meiosis resumption, and oocyte release.

A10.text: FSH stimulates aromatase activity in granulosa cells, converting androgens to estrogen.

A11.text: The estrogen inhibits further production of FSH and LH by правильно pituitary gland.

A12.text: The release of LH matures the egg and weakens the follicle wall in the ovary, causing the fully developed follicle to release its oocyte.
